last_episode_to_air.name: Football Is Life
last_episode_to_air.overview: A singular focus on promotion consumes the players, management and fans, who don't want to endure another season in League One.

name: Sunderland 'Til I Die
overview: This docuseries follows English soccer club Sunderland through the 2017-18 season as they try to bounce back after relegation from the Premier League.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: This docuseries follows English soccer club Sunderland through the 2017-18 season as they try to bounce back after relegation from the Premier League.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Under new ownership, Sunderland start on a quest to climb out of the third division and bring pride and hope back to the club's passionate fans.

episodes.name: Blinded By The Light
episodes.overview: Facing pressure from passionate supporters, Sunderland begin a new season in the second tier of English football following a disappointing relegation.

episodes.name: We Can’t Walk Away
episodes.overview: After a promising start to the season, the roster’s lack of depth is exposed. With money short, the team scrambles for help in the transfer window.

episodes.name: Plastic Shoes
episodes.overview: Frustration mounts among the players and fans as the team falls into the relegation zone, leaving manager Simon Grayson in a precarious position.

episodes.name: Rocking and Rolling
episodes.overview: A major shakeup brings renewed hope to the Stadium of Light, but as Christmas approaches, the team still seeks its first home win of the year.

episodes.name: Sticking Plasters
episodes.overview: The winter transfer window proves difficult when ownership refuses to put money in the club and a rarely used player collects on a massive contract.

episodes.name: No Guarantees
episodes.overview: Injuries mount as the team struggles to move clear of the relegation zone, but a key player's return to the lineup could provide a spark.

episodes.name: Changing the Landscape
episodes.overview: Desperation kicks in as the season winds down. A familiar face returns in an opposing jersey, while a current player makes an unfortunate mistake.

episodes.name: A Fresh Start
episodes.overview: With organizational upheaval on the horizon, coaches, players and staff consider their futures as fans pledge to stand behind the "lads" forever.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview: This docuseries follows English soccer club Sunderland through the 2017-18 season as they try to bounce back after relegation from the Premier League.

episodes.name: A Role in the Renaissance
episodes.overview: New owner Stewart Donald and director Charlie Methven begin the arduous task of bringing the club out of financial ruin while succeeding on the field.

episodes.name: The Old-Fashioned Way
episodes.overview: Stewart’s frustrations with agents mount during the club’s contract negotiations with key players, including young goal-scoring leader Josh Maja.

episodes.name: Pride, Passion and Loyalty
episodes.overview: Amid concerns about the front office culture, Charlie puts an aggressive marketing plan in place to draw the largest crowd in third division history.

episodes.name: Playing Poker
episodes.overview: In need of a striker to bolster the club's promotion bid, Stewart races against time to sign a key player by the January transfer deadline.

episodes.name: The Time for Men
episodes.overview: The team's run to a trophy final at Wembley Stadium brings pride and excitement to the long-suffering fans, who travel in huge numbers to London.

episodes.name: Football Is Life
episodes.overview: A singular focus on promotion consumes the players, management and fans, who don't want to endure another season in League One.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Under new ownership, Sunderland start on a quest to climb out of the third division and bring pride and hope back to the club's passionate fans.
